Package BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.Ball

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.Ball.Ball
Direct Known Subclasses:
RubberBall
public abstract class Ball extends Object
Abstract Ball class provides the abstraction of the ball object in the game. It is represented with a Shape object to be drawn in View.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ball

      public Ball(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB, javafx.scene.paint.Color inner, javafx.scene.paint.Color border)
      Creates an instance of a Ball of the given location, radius A and B, with the given color for the inside and the border.
      Parameters:
      center - Decides center of the Ball
      radiusA - The radius A for the Ball.
      radiusB - The radius B for the Ball.
      inner - The color of the inside of the Ball.
      border - The color of the border of the Ball.

    • makeBall

      protected abstract javafx.scene.shape.Shape makeBall(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB)
      Makes the Shape object of the ball of the given center, radius A and B.
      Parameters:
      center - Center of the Ball.
      radiusA - Radius A of the ball (Ball may be an Ellipse).
      radiusB - Radius B of the Ball
      Returns:
      Returns the created Shape object of the ball.

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves and updates the position of the ball based on the speed (X and Y). The center and the corner points of the Ball is updated.

      public void setBallAngle()
      Sets the angle of the ball randomly from -40 degrees to +40 degrees from the Y-axis.

    • calculateDeviation

      public void calculateDeviation(double playerX, double playerWidth)
      Calculates the deviation of the path of the ball when hitting the player. Then assigns the new speedX and speedY. Instead of a simple reverseY to reflect the collision of the ball and the player, the player can instead use the sides of the Player rectangle to control and deviate the direction of the ball.

      The closer the impact of the ball is to the edges of the player, the bigger the deviation.

      The closer the impact is to the center, the less the deviation.

      The left half of the player sways the path of the ball in a counter-clockwise direction.

      While the right half of the player sways the path of the ball in a clockwise direction.

      Parameters:
      playerX - Position of the player on the X-axis.
      playerWidth - Width of the player.

    • calculateAngleDeviationPercentage

      private double calculateAngleDeviationPercentage(double playerX, double playerWidth)
      Used in method calculateDeviation(). Calculates the percentage of how much of the angle does the original path of the ball deviate by (in %). Maximum percentage on the edges of the player, and 0 percentage on the center of the player.

      If the returning value is negative, the angle used to calculate the change will be the angle between the negative X-axis and the vector speed of the ball.

      If the returning value is positive, the angle used to calculate the change will be the angle between the positive X-axis and the vector speed of the ball.

      Parameters:
      playerX - Position of the player on the X-axis.
      playerWidth - Width of the player.
      Returns:
      The percentage change of the angle of the ball.
